alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 15 at 8:21PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Colorado and northeast Colorado, including the following counties, in east central Colorado, Cheyenne and Kit Carson. In northeast Colorado, Yuma. * WHEN...Until 3 AM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Strong, slow moving thunderstorms will continue this evening. These storms will move across the Front Range, with the potential for locally heavy rainfall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County
